alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Franklin; Hall; Kearney; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 10:21PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT FRANKLIN...NORTHWESTERN WEBSTER...ADAMS...KEARNEY...SOUTHEASTERN BUFFALO...EASTERN HARLAN AND SOUTHERN HALL COUNTIES THROUGH 1100 PM CDT... At 1021 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Shelton to near Norman to Bloomington. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Kenesaw, Upland, and Norman around 1025 PM CDT. Holstein and Prosser around 1030 PM CDT. Campbell around 1035 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Juniata, Bladen and Roseland. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 279 and 301. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for south central Nebraska. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until midnight CDT for south central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Buffalo; Franklin; Hall; Kearney; Webster
